answers.answer: I dont have it either but they keep testing me for it. High blood pressure, swelling that doesnt go away, headaches that get better with Tylenol and protein in your urine. Those are just some signs they tell me to look for.

I had it and had to be induced at 35 weeks ... It started with my feets and anckles getting swollen at around 30 weeks and it got really bad I had to buy really big shoes because of how huge my feets were and it hurt to walk to stay up to long my hands would go numb and wake me up when I was sleeping ... I was even my legs were starting to get swollen when I went to see the doctor I had high blood pressure so she sent me to l&d and from there on they kept me and told me I was not leaving the hospital pregnant
Yes bad swelling my whole body was swollen and high blood pressure I had my baby girl at 34 weeks because of it

question: who has had this? what were some of the symptoms for you..?i haven't been told i have it or anything, but i was reading about it some and i seen one of the possible symptoms was seeing little spots floating around.. this happens to me atleast once a week, so it just kinda scared me and i wanna know what to watch for??
title: Preeclampsia?
